title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.
speech: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving fo Jeromy's mother's speed.
speech: You are solving fo Jeromy's mother's speed.
pacedSpeech: You are solving fo Jeromy's mother's speed.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the Jeromy's mother's speed. Let's call Jeromy's mother's speed $$x$$. Since the Jeromy's mother's speed is $$20$$ mph slower than the Jeromy's speed, Jeromy's speed would be $$x-20$$.
speech: Create a variable to represent the Jeromy's mother's speed. Let's call Jeromy's mother's speed , x . Since the Jeromy's mother's speed is  20  mph slower than the Jeromy's speed, Jeromy's speed would be  x, minus 20 .

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the distances Jeromy and his mother traveled are the same, and the distance equals $$speed time$$.
speech: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the distances Jeromy and his mother traveled are the same, and the distance equals  speedtime .
pacedSpeech: Translate the situation into an equation using variable you named. Remeber that the distances Jeromy and his mother traveled are the same, and the distance equals   speedtime

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get $$6x=\operatorname{4.5}\left(x+20\right)$$.
speech: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get  6 x is equal to 4.5 of, parentheses x plus 20,  .
pacedSpeech: Multiply the speed of the drivers by the time to get   6 x is equal to 4.5 of,  x plus 20,

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for $$x$$?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$6x=\operatorname{4.5}\left(x+20\right)$$, we follow these steps: 6x=4.5x+90-->1.5x=90-->x=60.

speech: After solving the equation, what do you get for  x ?
